summary: The Department of Labor oversees unemployment insurance—distributing funds to states, who then provide these funds to eligible people within their state. During the COVID-19 pandemic, some states had trouble processing unemployment insurance claims due to issues with their IT systems—some of which are about 50 years old. DOL is helping states modernize these systems by, for example, sending experts to evaluate them and recommend improvements...
title: Unemployment Insurance: DOL Needs to Further Help States Overcome IT Modernization Challenges
